reviews.title: incredible service, excellent location
reviews.text: I stayed in the Renaissance Arts Hotel in New Orleans for 4 nights in September, 2008 while attending a conference. My stay was excellent, and the staff of this hotel were consistently helpful, friendly, and attentive.

I stayed in a room with two double beds, which I shared with a colleague. We found the space ample, the beds very comfortable, the TV selection good, all needed amenities. The mini-fridge in the room was locked, and when I called the front desk, they said that they had discontinued using the ones installed in the room, but immediately offered to bring up another for us. We loved the coffee and the bath products by Lather, which were completely restocked each day. Very comfortable, soft towels also. Climate control was excellent, very efficient A/C.
reviews.title: Nice Place To Stay In A Great Location

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was ideal, very close to the site of the conference I was attending (by the convention center), but significantly cheaper than the actual conference hotel (and closer to the nightlife). There is a rooftop patio and pool, where I sat to work one evening with my laptop and watched a gorgeous sunset. There are great restaurants on the same street or very close by, including Cochon (highly recommend), and also a wonderful self-serve wine bar called WINO (very highly recommend).
reviews.title: Looking Forward To My Next Visit

reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were amazing and saved my life, practically, on several occasions. At one point, I visited the Business Center on the ground floor to print a presentation text for the conference. The printer seemed to be having issues, so I stuck my head in the business office for assistance. A wonderfully sweet and helpful woman named Erica immediately interrupted her work and came to my rescue, and using my flash drive, she printed the presentation for me on the computer in her office, all in a matter of minutes. A true lifesaver! On the morning of my departure, the Airport Shuttle failed to arrive to pick me up, and the crew at the hotel’s front desk immediately took on the responsibility of calling the Shuttle office repeatedly until they got a response, demanding that the Shuttle come back and pick me up, all so that I wouldn’t have to pay extra for a taxi. They were fantastic and made a potentially stressful situation very easy. Also, Renee at the front desk, who checked me in, was very kind, greeting me by name with a smile every morning. It has been years since I stayed in a hotel with service of this exceptional quality.
reviews.title: Perfect for the Essence Festival!

reviews.text: I will definitely stay here when I return to New Orleans and recommend it to everyone I know. The service at the Renaissance Arts Hotel went well beyond the normal expectations of Southern hospitality—it was truly excellent.
reviews.title: Highly recommended!

reviews.text: Excellent hotel! Wonderful for those who like the energy of New Orleans, but not the chaos of the French Quarter. Close enough for a long stroll to get there, but far enough away that you don't have to experience it if you don't want to. Excellent restaurants within walking distance and many art galleries. Will be staying at this one again!
reviews.title: Fabulous Experience

reviews.text: This hotel lives up to its name. It is like staying in an art gallery. Art in the rooms, lobby, restaurant and a sculpture garden inside. We stayed for 5 nights in an interior view room which was very quiet. I booked through the Marriott site and received breakfast with the stay. Quite a deal! The hotel staff was all very helpful and we enjoyed the spectacular rooftop pool/spa. I was attending a conference at the convention center and this hotel was a short 5 block walk -very accessible. The only downside would be the price for parking, but this was similar at other area hotels.
reviews.title: Truly Spectacular

likes.liked: — Art everywhere and a great breakfast daily
likes.disliked: — Charge for internet and fee for parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time to stay in the Arts District and we couldn't have been more pleased. This hotel, part of the Marriot chain, is a wonderful redo of a warehouse in an up and coming area of New Orleans.
reviews.title: A fine hotel!

likes.disliked: — Paying $28 a day to park but that is par with the French Quarter area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is set up to show off local art and it does that well, with courtyards of sculpture to beautiful blown glass lighting to the water feature in the lobby to painting on many of the walls. The carpeting was brightly colored and added to the look I would call very hip.
reviews.title: Disappointed...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must say that I did book this through Priceline for under $70 so that enhances my appreciation. There are five floors total and we were on the fourth.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice, modern hotel. Beautiful public areas and rooms. Comfortable bed. Roof-top Pool. Great Value (we paid ~$100 per night). Pleasant, helpful staff (they provided many maps, cabs, and directions for us).
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel - Sub-par Restaurant
Comfortable Room, Chic space
reviews.text: We stayed at the Rennaissance Arts for 2 nights in June 2008. It was out first visit to New Orleans and the hotel was much better than we expected, bright, modern, clean, and a fairly good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You are about 3 blocks south of St. Charles Street (and the St. Charles Street trolley car which winds through the Garden District).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, even w/minor issues

reviews.text: You are a 15 minute walk or $7 cab ride from the French Quarter, close enough to be totally convenient, yet far enough to offer a nice respite each evening.
reviews.title: Loved New Orleans with kids
All Three Couples had a Great Time!
reviews.text: One block west of the hotel (literally 1 block, less 3 min walk) is Emeril's restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know why this hotel is so far down in the ranking .We're trying to stay at all the high ranked hotels in New Orleans and I can tell you this one belongs up at the top.This is one of the cleanest hotels we ever stayed.Great service,clean and modern rooms.,and a hot tub and pool on the roof.Also a workout room..The location is good ,very quiet area ,not too far from the action.I would highly recommend this hotel....
reviews.title: Class Act

likes.disliked: — The hot tub could use more pressure.

reviews.text: This was my seventh visit to New Orleans, and my second stay at the Renaissance Arts Hotel on Tchoupitoulas Street. What a GREAT place to stay - clean, luxurious, and with excellent staff/service. The rooms are great size (even the standard ones). The lobby boasts ever-changing artwork and access to the Albert Ross art gallery next door.
reviews.title: Fabulous Oasis in NOLA

likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything that I didn't like!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's super-convenient to the convention center, but no-one going to conventions there seems to know about it! All the better - it truly is an oasis. It's about a 5 minute walk to the French Quarter, so you can party on Bourbon Street without having your hotel in the middle of the partying!
reviews.title: Recommended - would definitely stay again

reviews.text: Great roof-top pool and excellent fitness facility too.
reviews.title: A relaxing Oasis in New Orleans

likes.disliked: — Not quick walking distance to the FQ. But streetcars during the day will get you there.

reviews.text: I have no complaints!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

likes.disliked: — internet service charge in the room rather than free wireless
